title: delaunay
text: problem asks draw 3 triangles among 5 points. assume correct way calculate Constrained Delauney Triangulation 5 points. workaround use limit number triangles 3 like However, solution temporary, exceptions break  three triangles drawn, point 3 completely skipped
code: trianglegsoc::run_DT(limit = 3) trianglegsoc::run_DT(   limit = 3,    input = matrix(c(5,6,8,2,9,1,7,9,2,4), ncol = 5, byrow = FALSE)) ##      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] ## [1,]    5    8    9    7    2 ## [2,]    6    2    1    9    4 ## [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" ## [1] 5 6 ## [1] 8 2 ## [1] 7 9 ## [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" ## [1] 5 6 ## [1] 8 2 ## [1] 2 4 ## [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" ## [1] 5 6 ## [1] 7 9 ## [1] 2 4

title: Standard Delaunay Triangulation
text: sample package created preliminary GSoC 2022 task. calculates Standard Delaunay Triangulation 5 points

title: Standard Delaunay Triangulation
text: can install development version trianglegsoc :

title: Standard Delaunay Triangulation
text: function calculate Standard Delaunay Triangulation: Input can also provided beforehand
code: trianglegsoc::run_DT()  trianglegsoc::run_DT(limit = 3) #stops execution after drawing 3 triangles trianglegsoc::run_DT(input = matrix(c(1,2,3,9,0,5,6,9,4,3), ncol = 5, byrow = FALSE)) #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] #> [1,]    1    3    0    6    4 #> [2,]    2    9    5    9    3 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 1 2 #> [1] 0 5 #> [1] 4 3 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 3 9 #> [1] 0 5 #> [1] 4 3 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 3 9 #> [1] 6 9 #> [1] 4 3

Delaunay Triangulation on 5 points — run_DT
text: calculates delaunay triangulation 5 points

title: Delaunay Triangulation on 5 points — run_DT
text: limit upper limit number triangles drawn, defaults infinite input 2x5 matrix can supplied, left blank user asked values runtime

title: Delaunay Triangulation on 5 points — run_DT
text: Plots standard delaunay triangulation 5 points. input takes 2x5 matrix input, takes values user runtime default

title: Delaunay Triangulation on 5 points — run_DT
code: if (FALSE) run_DT() if (FALSE) run_DT(limit = 3) run_DT(input = matrix(c(1,2,3,9,0,5,6,9,4,3), ncol = 5, byrow = FALSE)) #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] #> [1,]    1    3    0    6    4 #> [2,]    2    9    5    9    3  #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 1 2 #> [1] 0 5 #> [1] 4 3 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 3 9 #> [1] 0 5 #> [1] 4 3 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 3 9 #> [1] 6 9 #> [1] 4 3 run_DT(input = matrix(c(5,6,8,2,9,1,7,9,2,4), ncol = 5, byrow = FALSE)) #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] #> [1,]    5    8    9    7    2 #> [2,]    6    2    1    9    4  #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 5 6 #> [1] 8 2 #> [1] 7 9 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 5 6 #> [1] 8 2 #> [1] 2 4 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 5 6 #> [1] 7 9 #> [1] 2 4 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 8 2 #> [1] 9 1 #> [1] 7 9 #> [1] "Triangle drawn between points:" #> [1] 8 2 #> [1] 9 1 #> [1] 2 4
